alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 10 at 1:52PM MST until September 10 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Portions of the Navajo Nation and Hopi Reservation... Coconino County in north central Arizona... Navajo County in north central Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST /645 PM MDT/. * At 150 PM MST /250 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tuba City, Coalmine Canyon Chapter House, Forest Lake Chapter House, Wupatki National Monument, Hopi, Hopi Reservation, Moenkopi, Cameron and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following swimming holes... Tappan Spring. This includes the following highways... Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 330. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 463 and 481. State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 364. State Route 64 between mile markers 294 and 295. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Deadman Wash, Doney Mountain Wash, Oraibi Wash, Haada Is Taani Di Wash, Tse To Baah Naali Wash, Kish Zhini Wash, Kanaa Wash, Antelope Wash, Badger Wash, Hamblin Wash, Moenkopi Wash, White Water Wash, Taah Iiti Wash, Cedar Wash, Gold Spring Wash, Tohachi Wash, Paiute Trail Wash, Stone House Wash, Landmark Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Fivemile Wash, Dinnebito Wash, Citadel Wash, Little Colorado River, Saltwater Wash, Sei Haasgaii Wash, Begashibito Wash, Tonahakaad Spring, Little Mexican Spring Wash and Little Roden Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
